conversations.content: Yes? Who is it?
Pardon the intrusion, ma'am. I'm Victor, captain of the Shadewolves.
I'm...afraid I have news about your son, Anton.
...I've already heard. About you as well, Captain.
I see. Then I can only apologize. As captain, he was my responsibility.
You must be getting cold, dear. Please, come in for some hot tea.
Oh, I couldn't possibly intrude.
No need for formalities. Come on in. I'd like to speak with you anyway.
I...see. Then I'll gratefully accept.
Ha ha! Anton really did that?  Though I don't know why I'm surprised.
Captain, our boy really admired you. And now, having spoken with you, I've come to understand just why.
Thank you for coming to see us. I'm sure Anton would be pleased as well.
I can only hope.
Hm? Oh, Daniil. Come say hello to the captain.
Over here, boy! This is— Bah. Sorry. He's a shy one.
I take it he's...your grandson?
Yep. Anton's only child. His mother succumbed to illness a few years back, so now he lives with us.
Anton spoke of him often. He used to joke he was glad that Daniil got his mother's looks.
Ha ha! He certainly takes more after her. But his laugh and his mannerisms almost make it feel like Anton himself is here with us.
Not that there's been much laughter the last few days. The boy's grown distant.
Any particular reason?
Because Saint Starfall won't be coming this Dragonyule.
He won't?
Anton dressed up as Saint Starfall every year to deliver presents all throughout the village, you see.
But this year... Well, you know.
There was talk of some other adult taking his place, but there's just been too much fiend activity around here recently.
Ah. So there's no one in the village capable of delivering presents at night while fending off bloodthirsty fiends.
Our Daniil always looks forward to Saint Starfall coming around, too. Poor thing.
Then allow me to fill in.
You'll take up Saint Starfall's mantle yourself?
I know nothing will make up for your loss,  but at least let me do this for you.
We appreciate the gesture, but are you sure about this? It might be more of a handful than you're imagining...
You need to go around to each house in the village in advance and figure out what the children want, then deliver everything in one night on the big day.
And you have to keep the magic of Saint Starfall alive for the kids who still believe.
That DOES sound like a lot. But Anton did it every year, did he not?
He did, but there's hardly any time left before Dragonyule now. You've got your work cut out for you.
As it turns out, I have a connection that should come in handy on that front.
This person's network is as extensive as it is diverse. I'm sure they could  rustle up anything I need.
The real issue is getting everything here in time for the holiday. Otherwise, all your efforts will be for naught.
Don't worry. I already have a plan brewing.
Hm. As for the fiends, I suppose they'll be no trouble for you, if Anton's tales are to be believed. That just leaves...
The most important part of all! You can't spoil things for the little ones, so you'll have to wear the costume.
Quite right! You wouldn't be Saint Starfall without it! Though I'm afraid we don't have one that will fit you.
Not to worry. I happen to...already have my own.
(Never thought I'd be wearing it again, but I suppose needs must.)
It would be my honor to spread cheer in Anton's stead this year. You don't mind, do you?
Of course not. Besides, I doubt all the convincing in the world could change your mind at this point.
I'm sure Anton would be happy to know his beloved captain is carrying on his legacy.
Right you are. And...thank you for doing this for us. For Anton.
It's my honor, sir.
Halidom, Victor's Room
Well, that's the costume sorted, at least.
Now to visit each child's house and see what presents they're all hoping for.
Hm? Who are you?
I'm Victor, captain of the Shadewolves.
Ah, so you're the name on everyone's lips as of late—this year's Saint Starfall.
Yessir. I'll be paying you a visit on the night of Dragonyule. Thought I'd make the rounds and say hello in advance.
Well, I appreciate the personal touch. Awful long way to come just for a greeting!
That, and I was hoping to learn what kind of gifts your children might like this year.
Hm, let's see... A writing desk?  Reference books? No, that's what I'll be giving him myself.
You know what? I'll try asking on the sly. Come back tomorrow.
Understood. I'll swing by around this time.
Hm? What was that?
Looks like that dude'll be making the rounds on Dragonyule night dressed as Saint Starfall.
I smell a con in the making, Boss. ANYONE can wear that cheapo getup!
If we gussy ourselves up as Saint Starfall, the dorks in this village'll be all too happy to inv... Inveet? Invaht?
＂Invite us in,＂ dummy.
Th-that's right! Invite us in! You're sharp as a tack, Comet.
And you're as thick as ever, Prancer, but what you're TRYING to say is right.
If we can nose our way into those houses, all their stuff will be ours for the taking!
Gah ha ha ha ha!
Interesting scheme. Too bad it's about as deep as a puddle.
It's you! What are you doing here?!
You were acting suspicious right out in the open, so I followed you.
Hmph. To think you caught wind of our clever conniving... I knew you were no ordinary bloke.
You wanna rough him up, Boss?
Heh. Not so fast, Prancer. Think nice n' hard about who this guy might be.
You know how thinking makes my head hurt! But, uhhh... Errrm...
Oh. OHHH. I get it! Nobody comes back here 'cept us thieves so if we're here... and he's here...this guy, he must be a fellow, uh...crooner? No. Cook? Wait...
Are you trying to say ＂crook＂?
That's the one! You're a crook too, right? I mean, look at them muscles! And that scar! No way you're an upstanding member of society.
You're using this whole ＂presents for the kiddies＂ ruse to get in folks' houses, yeah?
Ha ha! Right on the money, Prancer! Yep, he's clearly another of society's dregs—a no-good criminal, like us.
And that being the case, how's about we join forces? Fate has brought us together.
Sorry to disappoint, but you've got it all wrong. I'm no crook, and there's no way I'm going to help you.
What?! But he asked so nicely! How can you be so argyle? Or...argonaut...
I think you mean ＂arrogant,＂ but I agree. Let's take this conceited brute out!
GWAAAAAH!
Sorry, sir! Won't happen again, sir!
Not to worry. Now make yourselves scarce and we'll call it even.
Hold on juuust a minute there, friend. If we don't make a score here, it's gonna  be a tough winter for us, y'see.
What he said! Maybe you could throw us a bone and share some'a the loot anyway?
I already told you, I'm not a thief.
Well, then what ARE you?
I'm Saint Starfall.
Pfft... BWAAAAH ha ha haaa! This guy's a real comedian, eh, Prancer?
O-oh, uh, yeah! A total knee-slapper!  Haven't laughed this hard in weeks.
AAAH HA HA HA!
Is it really so funny that I'm Saint Starfall? Maybe I need to teach you another lesson on manners.
Eep!
Sorry! We'll listen to whatever you say. Just, no more lessons!
Yeah, totally! We'll be obee... Obuh...
Obedient! Obedient to whatever you say. So please, don't kill us!
If you want to live, then get out of here. I have a lot of presents to get ready.
You're...actually serious about the Saint Starfall thing?
I already told you, it's no joke.
C'mon, man. You really think you can  get presents out to every kid in this village all by yourself?
That's the plan.
Then...let us help you!
What?! I didn't agree to that.
Quiet, you!
Sir, this may be a small country town, but there are a lotta kids here.
It'd be a nightmare to do everything on your own. A couple of extra hands'll help make sure things go real smooth-like.
What are you scheming now?
Nothing, sir! Nothing at all! We've just been moved by your ridiculous...er, rather, your EARNEST conviction!
...Fine. A few helpers will certainly come in handy.
Thank you! Prancer, thank the man!
Thank you, sir...
It's almost nightfall. You can help me starting tomorrow.
With pleasure!
Boss, we don't actually have to help him. Can't we just run away?
Prancer, you ignoramus. We're not gonna ＂help＂ with anything.
We're just gonna use him to get into folks' houses and carry out the original plan.
If we play this right, we can even pin the whole con on that big brute!
Oh. Ohhh! I don't really get how it's gonna work, but leave it up to you to come up with somethin' that smart, Boss!
Just you watch. We'll make a right mess of things, and then rub his smug nose in it!
WAAAH HA HA HA!
She'd like a telescope, then.
Our kid is really into pirates, so that'd really complete her look. Is that doable?
Shouldn't be an issue. I'll procure one and deliver it on Dragonyule.
Phew. Okay, all that's left...are the kids I was told to just ask directly.
I'll try talking to those young ladies over there first.
Eek! Who are you?
There's no need for alarm, miss. My name is Victor. I just have a quick question.
Behind me, Sister! Haven't I always told you not to talk to strangers on the street? Especially with all the rumors of thieves on the loose of late...
I assure you, my intentions are pure. I just want to ask if there's anything you wa—
Stay back! I know your game. You just want to lure us in with shiny baubles, and then BOOM! Kidnapped!
Then you stuff us in a big sack and whisk us off to some far off land to be sold on  the black market!
I'm scared...
Please calm down. I don't intend anything of the sort. If you would just listen—
I can't heear you! LA LA LA LA! Let's book it, Sis!
What in the world was that about?
We saw the whole thing, sir. With respect, you should leave this one to us.
You again. So, you think you can get them to tell you what they want?
No doubt. You come off as a big hulking brute. We're much more approachable.
Not sure I agree, but...fine. Give it a shot.
Hello there, little ladies! Why, it's almost Dragonyule, isn't it? And that means gifts! What are you hoping for this year?
Another stranger...
Let me guess: you want something too.
We are but humble census takers, traveling the land tallying people and households, and surveying their wants and needs.
That's right! We're centaurs! Er...censors? Wait, what was it?
Census takers, idiot.
Threat level raised to red. C'mon, Sis. Let's ditch these guys too.
No, wait! If we can't get accurate data, we'll be in big trouble! They'll...kill us!
They'll WHAT?!
Our manager is a terrible man. If his employees don't deliver results, he chews them up and spits them out like a wad of used gum!
Wait, for real?! That IS awful. Save us, Boss! I'm too young to die!
Me too! But if these kids don't tell us what they want, then it's curtains for us.
So please, little lady... Tell us what you want, if only to save us.
And if...we tell you... We won't get killed?
Yes! So you'll tell us?
Hmmm. I GUESS we can do that.
Woohoo!
So there you have it, good sir— the info you require!
Aw, that was so sweet, Boss! Little kids sharin' their hopes and dreams... It was so pyoo... Pyuh...
Pure? Indeed it was. Confronted with  uncorrupted youth, one can't help but want to protect it.
(I think we've won Mr. Meathead's trust. All that's left is to do our thieving on Dragonyule and lay the blame on him!)
Good work. I expect you to be just as thorough with the next one.
Yeah, defin— Wait, what?
According to my list, there's still... Gene, Lian, Sarasa... Seis, Siete, and Ocho.
Wait, wait, wait. There are more?! And we have to ask ALL of them what they want?
That's what you volunteered for, yes. Now, move out. I'll take that house over there.
Comet, are we really gonna do this?
Nrgh... Yeah. It's the only way to make our plan work. Let's go, Prancer!
Oh, Captain. How can I help you today?
I wanted to ask you what Daniil wants for Dragonyule.
Hm. I think his granddad would know.  Come in, come in.
Dear, has Daniil mentioned to you what he wants for Dragonyule this year?
Oh, hello, Captain! You know, I asked the boy, but he wouldn't tell me.
Oh? Any particular reason?
He said he'd only tell Saint Starfall.
He must think if he tells anyone else, his wish won't come true.
Hm. Quite a pickle.
Another guest? Who is it now?
Yes, begging your pardon. Hello.
Noelle? What is it? Orders from home?
Um... Yes, there's a letter for you from a...certain someone.
A missive from Litvinov, then. ...Hey. That's it, Noelle!
Huh? What's it...?
You're back. How'd it go?
*gulp* Here.
Daniil asked me to deliver this letter... to Saint Starfall.
Bingo. Now, I know it's improper to open other people's mail. But right now, I'm exactly who this letter was intended for.
Mhm, mhm... I see. So that's what Daniil is after.
Sir?
Hm. This...will be a hard present to find.
WHOOOA! Dragons sure are fast! Prancer, hold on tight to that sack of goodies!
WHAT WAS THAT? Can't hear you over the wind, Boss!
(Getting all the presents took longer than I'd planned, but this dragon ride should make up the difference.)
(Help with the presents, plus a dragon to airlift them... I owe Euden a debt.)
(Hopefully things go smoothly from here.)
Gah! The wind blew the sack of presents away!
What'd I JUST say, you nimrod?!
I'll hop off and round them up. You two head to the village and get ready for our deliveries.
Hop off...a moving dragon?! But that's madness, good sir! You'll just be dashed to pieces on the ground!
I'll do anything to make those kids smile. Leave this to me. You go on ahead.
No way! He JUMPED! Uh, Boss, what do we do now? Are we gonna do what he said?
No, dingus! We're thieves! Who cares about a bunch of sad little kids and their...big, tearful puppy-dog eyes...
Okay, FINE. We'll do what he says, but if he doesn't show up, we're robbing the place blind like I planned!
(The wind has carried the presents quite a ways away. I wonder if I can even catch up before I'll have to open my chute...)
(All right, I grabbed the sack. Time to open my parachute!)
(What?! It won't open!)
(A malfunction? Think, Victor... Landing at this speed will surely kill me.)
(I'm barreling faster by the second. No time to think. I need to cushion my landing somehow!)
GRRRAAAAAGH!  Candy Cane Offensive!
Phew. That seems to have dulled my impact just enough to save my skin.
The presents are intact too.  I must hurry to the village, and—hm?
Ah. These must be the fiends the villagers mentioned.
Guess we're in for a melee!
Time's up, Boss. I'm sure our hulkin' friend's a person-sized puddle of goo by now. No sense waiting anymore.
You're...probably right.
The longer we wait, the less time we'll have for robbing. C'mon, Boss!
...I guess you're right. It's a shame we won't be able to make him our scapegoat, but I suppose we don't have much choice.
We're back to our original plan: pose as Saint Starfall and clean this village out!
What's this about a plan?
What?! Sir, you're all right!
I knew you were up to something, but I didn't expect it'd be quite so vile.
Hmph. No use pretending anymore. Well? What are you going to do?  Brutalize us and toss us out in the cold?
Later, if you like. But first, I still need help delivering these presents.
No way! We's thieves! Robbing folks is our cauliflower... Er, our collie...
Our calling, numskull. And you're quite right.
This is the only way we know how to live. We're too broke to be giving things away!
Is robbing people REALLY your heart's calling?
Huh? Whaddya mean?
Hearing those kids' wishes, didn't part of you want to make them come true? To see the joy on their faces as they opened the presents they so badly wanted?
There's a child in this village who I want to make happy, you see. He heard Saint Starfall wasn't coming this year and completely shut himself away.
It's my fault he's going through that. So to make amends, I'm doing something that's...outside of my comfort zone.
Good sir...
Your scheme will rob innocent children of what little joy I can give them this year. But you can still choose a different path.
A thief can't make these kids happy. But Saint Starfall can. Which will you be?
Of course we WANNA make those kids happy, but what choice do we have?!
Bad case o' the blues ain't never killed nobody. If thieving keeps US alive, what's it matter if we make a few kids cry?
If you truly think you won't regret it, then so be it. But I know you will.
I'm not so unfeeling that I can let people walk down the wrong path uncontested.
If you need it, I can pay you a little for your labor out of my own pocket.
Whoa, really?
So you have to choose. Will you steal joy, or will you give it?
I...guess we can make an exception, it being Dragonyule and all. We'll help you make those kids happy.
If the boss says so, then I'll help too. I'm not a thief tonight—I'm Saint Starfall!
You and I both, my friend.
Just one house left...
Urgh...
Hello? Is... Is that you, Saint Starfall?
Hello, Daniil. Sorry to wake you.
It's really you! Did you bring me a present?!
I read your letter.
But I'm afraid I can't give you what you asked for this year.
Why not?! I've been so good! Why can't you do it?!
I just want to see my dad again! Please!
I'm sorry, Daniil. Your father is no longer here in this world. I can't bring him back.
No! He said he'd come home! Saint Starfall came, so why can't Dad?!
Daniil, I know it can't take your father's place, but...this is for you.
And...I'm sorry.
Saint Starfall, wait!
This is...
Check out my new telescope! One step closer to pirate queen!
I got a teddy bear! It's so cute!
Hee hee. I'm glad for you both, but you'll never guess what I got from Saint Starfall!
Look, Boss. They're all so happy. Makes me so proud we were able to give them Saint Starfall's buh... Bleh...
Blessing, you simpleton? But yes, you're quite right.
Last night left us none the richer, but I'm glad we could bring these kids such joy.
*sniff*
Huh? You cryin', Boss?
Don't be ridiculous! My nose is just running from the cold, that's all.
There you are.
Good sir! Did you need something?
I just wanted to give you your payment for helping me with the Saint Starfall gig.
This is quite the sum! Are you sure?
Boss, this is enough to get us through the winter. We don't hafta starve!
And you don't have to thieve either. You can live life on the straight and narrow.
This is life-changing! Thank you!
No need to thank me. You helped me pay off my own debt, so now we're even.
Going forward, just don't do anything that'd make a child sad...or you'll regret it, just like I did.
Y'know, you look scary, but you really got a heart of gold, huh?
Enough yapping. Get out of here, you two.
We won't forget this. If you ever need some extra hands again, let us know and we'll come running!
Now, then... It's time I moved along as well.
Wait!
Oh, Daniil. What is it?
You're the captain my dad talked about, right?
I am. Anton served under me.
And last night, when Saint Starfall came... That was you, right?
Saint Starfall gave me Dad's old cap. Only his captain could've gotten that.
I'm sorry, Daniil. I failed as Saint Starfall. I couldn't give you what you really wanted.
I only hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me.
Don't be sorry, Captain! You weren't a failure at all!
But...
Since Dad isn't around anymore, I didn't think Saint Starfall would come at all this Dragonyule.
I knew no one could give me what I REALLY wanted, so I didn't say anything when I was asked.
But getting that present yesterday made me feel a little like Dad had come back after all. It made me really happy.
Daniil...
(He really is just like his dad. Especially when he smiles.)
(I'm sorry, Anton. You should be here. It should have been me...)
I don't blame you, Captain. You're a good man.
Wh—?!
Thank you for everything, Captain! Come back next year and tell me more about my dad. I'll be waiting!
I'll be good until then. I promise!
It's a deal, kiddo. Be a good boy, and I'm sure I'll see you again next year.
Okay! Bye for now, Captain! And Happy Dragonyule!
...Happy Dragonyule, Daniil.
